1:
God has made himself known in Judah;\q his name is great in Israel.
\q
2:
His tent is in Salem;\q his dwelling place is in Zion.
\q
3:
There he broke the arrows of the bow,\q the shield, the sword, and the other weapons of war.
\qs Selah\qs*


\q
4:
You shine brightly and reveal your glory,\q as you descend from the mountains, where you killed your victims.
\q
5:
The bravehearted were plundered;\q they fell asleep.
\q All the warriors were helpless.


\q
6:
At your rebuke, God of Jacob,\q both rider and horse fell asleep.
\q
7:
You, yes you, are to be feared;\q who can stand in your sight when you are angry?


\q
8:
From heaven you made your judgment heard;\q the earth was afraid and silent
\q
9:
when you, God, arose to execute judgment\q and to save all the oppressed of the earth.
\qs Selah\qs*


\q
10:
Surely your angry judgment against humanity will bring you praise;\q you gird yourself with what is left of your anger.


\q
11:
Make vows to Yahweh your God and keep them.\q May all who surround him bring gifts to him who is to be feared.
\q
12: He cuts off the spirit of the princes;\q he is feared by the kings of the earth.
